definition: well versed in letters and military technology (idiom); fine scholar and soldier/master of pen and sword
talent in both military and civil field (idiom)
civilians and the military (working) hand in hand (idiom)

sentences.english: The Emperor is endowed with civil and martial virtues.
sentences.chinese: 这个皇帝天赋文武双全。

sentences.english: I envy you for giving such a personable and astute son gifted in both cultural and military affairs.
sentences.chinese: 朕羡慕你，有这样识大体明事理，且文武兼备的儿子。

sentences.english: He wrote a book of poetry, and he was a both civil and military general.
sentences.chinese: 留有诗集一部，是住文武兼备的将军。

sentences.english: Finally, all civil and military officials in the court held high wine glasses to congratulate on Emperor Xuanzong birthday.
sentences.chinese: 最后朝中文武百官高举酒杯齐声为玄宗祝寿。

sentences.english: She served as high school is the famous universities charge wenwu double royal hall college.
sentences.chinese: 她出任的高中是文武双收的有名高校御堂学院。

sentences.english: Chiang by the Minister from both sides of the East-West gate access.
sentences.chinese: 文武大臣按文东武西由两侧门出入。

sentences.english: One day, the King and all the top civil and military officials went to the ocean in a dragon boat to sightsee.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，国王和很多文武百官一起坐龙船出海游玩。

sentences.english: All officials were waiting to see Beigong She's gaffe.
sentences.chinese: 文武百官于是都在旁等着看北宫奢如何出丑。

sentences.english: Once the emperor got angry, all the officials would kneel down.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝一发怒，文武百官都跪了下来。

sentences.english: The old in the queens birthday came to congratulate.
sentences.chinese: 各朝文武百官前来祝贺皇后生日。

definition: the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
